segment.source: Using the SUA Wizard (Windows 10)
segment.target: Using the SUA Wizard (Windows 10)

segment.source: The Standard User Analyzer (SUA) Wizard works much like the SUA tool to evaluate User Account Control (UAC) issues.
segment.target: The Standard User Analyzer (SUA) Wizard works much like the SUA tool to evaluate User Account Control (UAC) issues.

segment.source: However, the SUA Wizard does not offer detailed analysis, and it cannot disable virtualization or elevate your permissions.
segment.target: However, the SUA Wizard does not offer detailed analysis, and it cannot disable virtualization or elevate your permissions.

segment.source: Using the SUA Wizard
segment.target: Using the SUA Wizard

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: The Standard User Analyzer (SUA) Wizard works much like the SUA tool to evaluate User Account Control (UAC) issues.
segment.target: The Standard User Analyzer (SUA) Wizard works much like the SUA tool to evaluate User Account Control (UAC) issues.

segment.source: However, the SUA Wizard does not offer detailed analysis, and it cannot disable virtualization or elevate your permissions.
segment.target: However, the SUA Wizard does not offer detailed analysis, and it cannot disable virtualization or elevate your permissions.

segment.source: For information about the SUA tool, see Using the SUA Tool.
segment.target: For information about the SUA tool, see Using the SUA Tool.

segment.source: Testing an Application by Using the SUA Wizard
segment.target: Testing an Application by Using the SUA Wizard

segment.source: You must install Application Verifier before you can use the SUA Wizard.
segment.target: You must install Application Verifier before you can use the SUA Wizard.

segment.source: If Application Verifier is not installed on the computer that is running the SUA Wizard, the SUA Wizard notifies you.
segment.target: If Application Verifier is not installed on the computer that is running the SUA Wizard, the SUA Wizard notifies you.

segment.source: You must also install the Microsoft® .NET Framework 3.5 or later before you can use the SUA Wizard.
segment.target: You must also install the Microsoft® .NET Framework 3.5 or later before you can use the SUA Wizard.

segment.source: The following flowchart shows the process of using the SUA Wizard.
segment.target: The following flowchart shows the process of using the SUA Wizard.

segment.source: act sua wizard flowchart
segment.target: act sua wizard flowchart

segment.source: To test an application by using the SUA Wizard
segment.target: To test an application by using the SUA Wizard

segment.source: On the computer where the SUA Wizard is installed, log on by using a non-administrator account.
segment.target: On the computer where the SUA Wizard is installed, log on by using a non-administrator account.

segment.source: Run the Standard User Analyzer Wizard.
segment.target: Run the Standard User Analyzer Wizard.

segment.source: Click Browse for Application, browse to the folder that contains the application that you want to test, and then double-click the executable file for the application.
segment.target: Click Browse for Application, browse to the folder that contains the application that you want to test, and then double-click the executable file for the application.

segment.source: Click Launch.
segment.target: Click Launch.

segment.source: If you are prompted, elevate your permissions.
segment.target: If you are prompted, elevate your permissions.

segment.source: The SUA Wizard may require elevation of permissions to correctly diagnose the application.
segment.target: The SUA Wizard may require elevation of permissions to correctly diagnose the application.

segment.source: If a Permission denied dialog box appears, click OK.
segment.target: If a Permission denied dialog box appears, click OK.

segment.source: The application starts, despite the warning.
segment.target: The application starts, despite the warning.

segment.source: In the application, exercise the functionality that you want to test.
segment.target: In the application, exercise the functionality that you want to test.

segment.source: After you finish testing, exit the application.
segment.target: After you finish testing, exit the application.

segment.source: The SUA Wizard displays a message that asks whether the application ran without any issues.
segment.target: The SUA Wizard displays a message that asks whether the application ran without any issues.

segment.source: Click No.
segment.target: Click No.

segment.source: The SUA Wizard shows a list of potential remedies that you might use to fix the application.
segment.target: The SUA Wizard shows a list of potential remedies that you might use to fix the application.

segment.source: Select the fixes that you want to apply, and then click Launch.
segment.target: Select the fixes that you want to apply, and then click Launch.

segment.source: The application appears again, with the fixes applied.
segment.target: The application appears again, with the fixes applied.

segment.source: Test the application again, and after you finish testing, exit the application.
segment.target: Test the application again, and after you finish testing, exit the application.

segment.source: The SUA Wizard displays a message that asks whether the application ran without any issues.
segment.target: The SUA Wizard displays a message that asks whether the application ran without any issues.

segment.source: If the application ran correctly, click Yes.
segment.target: If the application ran correctly, click Yes.

segment.source: The SUA Wizard closes the issue as resolved on the local computer.
segment.target: The SUA Wizard closes the issue as resolved on the local computer.

segment.source: If the remedies do not fix the issue with the application, click No again, and the wizard may offer additional remedies.
segment.target: If the remedies do not fix the issue with the application, click No again, and the wizard may offer additional remedies.

segment.source: If the additional remedies do not fix the issue, the wizard informs you that there are no more remedies available.
segment.target: If the additional remedies do not fix the issue, the wizard informs you that there are no more remedies available.

segment.source: For information about how to run the SUA tool for additional investigation, see Using the SUA Tool.
segment.target: For information about how to run the SUA tool for additional investigation, see Using the SUA Tool.
